function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Potential correlation between human mobility and growth rates of daily case counts from Wuhan","Impact":"Could lead to a rapid spread of contagious diseases across provinces","Mitigation":"Implement strict travel restrictions and control measures in locations with larger outbreaks","Technologies":"Travel restrictions, surveillance technology, and contact tracing","People":"Residents and travelers in affected provinces","Owner":"Local government and health authorities"},{"Description":"Increased testing capacity coinciding with the travel ban","Impact":"May result in an alternative hypothesis for observed epidemiological patterns and compromise the accuracy of data","Mitigation":"Ensure that testing capacity does not introduce bias in data analysis and interpretation","Technologies":"Random sampling, data normalization, and quality control measures","People":"Epidemiologists, statisticians, and data analysts","Owner":"Health authorities and research institutions"},{"Description":"Inclusion of mobility data from Wuhan resulting in improved model prediction","Impact":"Could create over-reliance on mobility data and overlook other contributing factors to disease spread","Mitigation":"Use multiple data sources and consider the influence of various factors on disease transmission","Technologies":"Data integration and analysis tools, machine learning algorithms, and multi-factor modeling","People":"Epidemiologists, data scientists, and public health researchers","Owner":"Research institutions and public health agencies"}]}
